laboratory_examinations.findings: During the episode, a period of fast, sustained ventricular tachycardia was recorded, followed by ventricular fibrillation after the first shock. The device delivered the first shock at a low impedance of 24 立 with a fixed energy level of 80 J and converted the patient back to sinus rhythm with a further shock at a low impedance of 24 立.
The device was confirmed to work properly, delivering shocks at a normal impedance of 57 立 and a fixed energy level of 80 J.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: 2 months after the incident, another episode was recorded where the device delivered a shock with normal impedance of 64 立 and energy level of 80 J.
